intro: Rhinanthus pulcher subsp. alpinus, commonly known as the alpine yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has slender, branching stems and pinnately divided leaves. This subspecies is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas with limited soil nutrients.
